entries.name: Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery
entries.description: In a Benoit Blanc mystery, the cast is just as important as the crime. For the third Knives Out film, Daniel Craig’s southern detective will be surrounded by some of the biggest talents in Hollywood, and you’ll forgive us if we name drop just a few. Josh Brolin, Glenn Close, Mila Kunis, Josh O'Connor Kerry Washington, Andrew Scott, and Cailee Spaeny will all contribute to the conundrum at the center of Rian Johnson’s new feature that the trailer has called “the holy grail” of murders. — Adrienne

entries.name: Influencers
entries.description: Cassandra Naud returns as secret psychopath CW in this sequel to Kurtis David Harder’s 2022 indie fave Influencer. This time around, CW’s idyllic life in Southern France is upended when a popular social media star (Georgina Campbell) insinuates herself into her life. Be on the lookout for the return of previous victim Madison (Emily Tennant) who may not be as canceled as she seems … — Adrienne

entries.name: Silent Night, Deadly Night
entries.description: Christmas is coming early with this reboot of the ultra-sleazy ‘80s slasher Silent Night, Deadly Night. Directed Mike P. Nelson, the new version reframes the killer in a Santa Claus suit as a “Dexter”-like anti-hero. Rohan Campbell (The Monkey, Halloween Ends) is terrific as the killer, and there are enough twists, laughs, and kills in this new Silent Night, Deadly Night to recommend watching it in the theater this month. — James

entries.name: Fallout
entries.detail: Season 2 premieres on Prime Video Dec. 17
entries.description: Viva New Vegas! All bets are off in Season 2 of this hit series as our ragtag team of heroes search for justice in the city of sin. When we last saw our dystopian darlings, Lucy and the Ghoul had joined forces in pursuit of Lucy’s father, Hank, who was revealed to be not only a formerly frozen Vault-Tec exec but also responsible for countless deaths. Meanwhile, after being knocked unconscious during battle, Maximus was left behind with the Brotherhood of Steel. Now, our apocalyptic survivors must risk it all in the hopes of capturing Hank, finding the Ghoul’s family, and learning more about the world before the fall(out). Keep an eye out for new cast members, including Kumail Nanjiani, Macaulay Culkin, and Justin Theroux as New Vegas’ mysterious ruler, Mr. House. — Adrienne

entries.name: The Game Awards
entries.detail: Premieres on YouTube, Twitch, and Prime Video on Dec. 11
entries.description: After dominating the Golden Joystick Awards with seven wins, the turn-based RPG Clair Obscur: Expedition has its sights on The Game Awards Its 12 nominations set a new record for the ceremony, but a sweep isn't guaranteed. This year has been stellar for gaming, with powerhouse titles like Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Ghosts of Yotei, Hades II, Hollow Knight: Silksong, Blue Prince,; and Kingdom Come: Deliverance II in the running across multiple categories. If you're a fan of gaming, the dozens of world premiere trailers and new game announcements make The Game Awards a must-watch event. — Vanessa

entries.name: The Abandons
entries.description: Gillian Anderson and Lena Headey face off in a battle of the haves and have-nots in this gritty drama from Kurt Sutter (Sons of Anarchy) that's set in the lawless 1800s' Washington Territory. Westerns aren't typically my thing, but throw in a found family of outcasts, star-crossed lovers, and kick-ass matriarchs? Count me in. — Vanessa

entries.name: Five Nights at Freddy's 2
entries.description: A FNAF sequel was inevitable after the first movie became the highest grossing horror film of 2023. This time around, terrifying events are set in motion when Abby tries to reconnect with her animatronic friends, unleashing a long-forgotten horror. Expect this second outing to expand on the first film's lore, although we're hoping for a nod to the second game via some kind of prequel subplot (c'mon, Yello Rabbit!). Josh Hutcherson, Elizabeth Lail, Piper Rubio, and Matthew Lillard reprise their roles, plus horror heartthrob Skeet Ulrich and Zoomer icon Mckenna Grace are joining in on the Freddy’s fun. But will it be scary? Matthew Lillard thinks so, saying in a recent interview that the sequel is more action-packed, “amped up,” and will feature more jump scares. Hold onto your popcorn. — Adrienne

entries.name: Jay Kelly
entries.description: Jay Kelly is the movie I’ll watch with my mom over the holidays. She’ll enjoy her annual glass of wine and remind me George Clooney is her hall pass. I’m not sure she’ll respond favorably to Clooney playing a self-possessed Hollywood icon in the twilight of his career; she’ll connect more with Adam Sandler — our New Hampshire hometown hero — as Ron Sukenick, Kelly's devoted manager. Sandler's performance is more than worth the 20% Sukenick earns from his client's going rate and acts as the film's discernable heartbeat. — Arno

entries.name: Hamnet
entries.description: Don’t forget your tissues when you head to the theaters to see Academy Award winner Chloé Zhao’s new film. Based on Maggie O’Farrell’s novel of the same name, Hamnet presents the love story and tragedy that inspired William Shakespeare’s “Hamlet.” Paul Mescal and Jessie Buckely star as the playwright and his bride through every stage of life from blissful companions to broken mourners and beyond as they begin to heal through art. — Adrienne

entries.name: The Secret Agent
entries.description: My advice is to go on a bender of your choice before seeing The Secret Agent so you can fully soak in its sweat. Most of the time I just like looking at Wagner Moura, but the movie provides the actor with his finest role to date, and it heralds the complete arrival of Kleber Mendonça Filho as a filmmaker (shout out to fellow Bacurau fans.) Set in 1977 Brazil, Moura stars as a tech expert who seeks refuge in his hometown. I won’t divulge more plot details, but you should be a fan of slower cinema if you want to extract all the juice and pulp from one of the best movies of the year, truly. RIP, Udo Kier. — Arno

entries.name: Atropia
entries.description: Director Hailey Gates described her new film Atropia as a satire in the tradition of stories like “M.A.S.H.” And while that’s technically true, you’ve never seen a movie quite like this. Set at a US military training camp during the Iraq war, Atropia follows Fayruz (Alia Shawkat), an aspiring actress working as part of a 24/7 roleplaying experience for deploying soldiers. Along the way, she develops a friendship with fellow reenactor and veteran (Callum Turner), who is playing a “terrorist” named Abu Dice. What this description doesn’t capture is the lunacy of watching adults LARP war, complete with mock IEDs, fog-machine mustard gas, fake limbs, and olfactory experiences like “rotting flesh.” Come for the lampooning of the military-industrial complex; stay for the surprisingly touching romance between Shawkat and Turner; and then leave with your mind blown when you realize the Atropia camp is a real part of U.S. military training. — Adrienne

entries.name: Dust Bunny
entries.description: Since it’s highly unlikely we’ll ever get a new season of “Hannibal,” at least Mads Mikkelsen and Bryan Fuller are still making dark fantasies together. Mikkelsen plays a dodgy neighbor recruited by a young girl who thinks a monster ate her family, and I’m sensing the kid plays a key role in a larger story that connects Mikkelsen with Sigourney Weaver, David Dastmalchian, and Sheila Atim’s characters. The movie looks like it was created in the Upside Down version of Coeur d'Coeurs, the fictional town where Fuller’s dearly departed series “Pushing Daises” was set, and that’s the reason I’ll seek out this indie release in theaters. — Arno

entries.name: Avatar: Fire and Ash
entries.description: You’ve had three years to recover from the sumptuous spectacle that was James Cameron’s Avatar: The Way of Water, but now it’s time to hop on your ikran and “go deeper,” says Cameron. Fire and Ash explores the consequences of the mounting unrest on the faraway world of Pandora through characters who are much more morally gray than previous films. In this installment, former Marine turned Na’vi leader Jake Sully (Sam Worthington) and his family will encounter the Ash people, a Na’vi tribe led by the brutal sorceress Varang (Oona Chaplin). Cameron claims Fire and Ash is a culmination to his epic elemental fantasy, and will act as an ending in some ways, which is a good thing because fans will have to wait until 2029 to see Part Four. — Adrienne

entries.name: The Housemaid
entries.description: Amanda Seyfried is not a cool mom in this thriller that's based on the wildly popular novel from the mysterious, pseudonymized, fanbase-trolling author Freida McFadden. I’ve not read the book and don’t want to predict any of its twists; I just want to see Seyfried spar with Sydney Sweeney, who plays a domestic worker with a past who moves into the Winchester family home, which is clearly a nut house. Also, I hope director Paul Feig is able to leave Another Simple Favor behind him. — Arno

entries.name: Is This Thing On?
entries.description: Bradley Cooper’s crisis comedy feels like his most personal film yet as a writer-director. Will Arnett and Laura Dern co-star as a couple facing relatable mid-life challenges — potential divorce and other blues — causing Arnett’s bummed-out dad to try his hand at stand-up comedy. Is This Thing On? could be a tough sell at Christmastime, but something tells me the movie could linger at the box office into the new year. If you care about the Oscar races, the movie seems to be a longshot in all the major categories, which would be a first-time shutout for Cooper-as-director. — Arno

entries.name: Stranger Things
entries.detail: Season 5, Volume 2 and 3 premiere Dec. 25 and Jan. 1 on Netflix
entries.description: After racing through four seasons in two months, then restraining myself from binge-watching the start of season 5 after Thanksgiving dinner, I'm facing a hard truth: I'm not ready for this story to end. It's hard to believe we've been on this adventure for almost a decade (and watched Millie, Finn, Caleb and the gang grow into their twenties!). This Christmas, the party makes their final stand against Vecna and The Upside Down. May all of their rolls be natural twenties. Three episodes left, gang. We can do this! — Vanessa

entries.name: Anaconda
entries.description: I don’t know about you, but I’m ready for some goofiness to close out the year. Fortunately, Jack Black and Paul Rudd are on the way to lighten and brighten these dark times with a franchise reboot … of sorts. In Anaconda, two friends experiencing a mid-life crisis decide to remake their favorite ‘90s film (the original Anaconda from '97, in case you didn’t catch on). But what starts as a fun-loving adventure becomes chaotic when a real giant anaconda begins stalking the indie filmmakers. With Steve Zahn and Thandiwe Newton along for the ride, and that brilliant use of “Baby Got Back” in the trailer, this looks like the kind of silly meta comedy the whole family can enjoy. — Adrienne

entries.name: Marty Supreme
entries.description: Timothée Chalamet teams up with director Josh Safdie for this character-driven picture about ping pong. Loosely based on the real-life player Marty Reisman, the first feature from Josh since Uncut Gems looks like it will deliver all the drama moviegoers have come to expect from a Safdie brother as Marty paddles, hustles, and romances his way through 1950s NYC in pursuit of greatness. — Adrienne

entries.name: Frankenstein
entries.description: With his heart on his sleeve and a devilish grin on his lips, Mexican auteur Guillermo del Toro explained that adapting Mary Shelley’s masterwork into a personal fable of fathers and sons is “like marrying a widow – you have to respect the memory of the late husband. But on Saturday, you gotta party on.” Oscar Isaac plays the bad dad/mad scientist Dr. Victor Frankenstein, while Jacob Elordi absolutely disappears, physically and vocally, into the role of del Toro’s misunderstood monster, whose reanimated tissue is the beating heart of this extremely earnest and epic morality play. Not to mention, the visual spectacle of del Toro’s rip-roaring retelling hits harder than the Creature’s super-powered punches that literally break a man’s back in half during the film’s arctic ass-kicking of an opening. — Alex

entries.name: Pluribus
entries.description: Vince Gilligan returns to both Albuquerque and his sci-fi roots with "Pluribus," his new and twisty take on the pandemic genre. The intriguing premise follows Carol (Rhea Seehorn) as the only person immune to a virus that causes uncontrollable optimism and happiness. With the tagline, "The most miserable person on Earth must save the world from happiness," I can't wait to see how this one plays out. I mean, would a world full of happiness and optimism be a bad thing? The series marks a reunion between Gilligan and "Better Call Saul" star Seehorn, and has been greenlit for two seasons before its debut. Given Gilligan's track record and Apple TV's track record of leaning into high-quality sci-fi programming, my expectations are high for this one. —Vanessa

entries.name: Wicked: For Good
entries.description: Millions of people are breathlessly anticipating Wicked’s second act, which touches down almost exactly one year from the first movie. Variety is reporting first reactions for the highly anticipated follow-up are overwhelmingly positive, with early audiences calling it "next level," praising the performances, and clamoring for repeat viewings. Director Jon M. Chu claims there are some surprises in store, even for the most die-hard fans of the book and stage play. One surprise we don't have to wait for is the addition of Colman Domingo, who will voice the Cowardly Lion alongside the A-list returning cast. — Adrienne

entries.name: Zootopia 2
entries.description: We can't believe it's been almost a decade since Zootopia took the world by storm, becoming one of the biggest hits of the year with over $1 billion at the worldwide box office. In Zootopia 2, beloved duo Judy Hopps (Ginnifer Goodwin) and Nick Wilde (Jason Bateman) return for another adventure, this time investigating a mysterious reptilian newcomer who throws their mammalian metropolis into chaos. In addition to Shakira reprising her role as the Zootopian popstar Gazelle, comedian Fortune Feimster and Oscar winner Ke Huy Quan join the cast. — Vanessa

entries.name: Eternity
entries.description: It’s Albert Brooks’ Defending Your Life meets Celine Song’s Past Lives (Defending Your Past Lives?) as a recently-deceased Elizabeth Olsen struggles to choose whether she spends eternity with her first love (Callum Turner), or her husband (Miles Teller), while the lovers’ triangle fumbles through the sumptuous production design of a mid-century modern limbo. Olsen and her plucky Afterlife Coordinators, played by Da’Vine Joy Randolph and John Early, are too much fun in this funny, charming, and slightly-too-long romantic comedy. — Alex

titleText.text: Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery

plotText.plainText: Benoit Blanc returns for his most dangerous case yet.
In Southern France, a young woman's chilling fascination with murder and identity theft sends her life into a whirlwind of chaos.

node.text: Noche de paz, noche de horror
Noche de paz, noche de horror
Noche de paz, noche de horror
Noche de Paz, Noche de Horror
Noite de Amor, Noite de Terror

plotText.plainText: A child witnesses his parents' murder by a man in a Santa suit. Years later, as an adult, he dons a Santa costume himself and embarks on a violent quest for retribution against those responsible for the traumatic event from his childhood.
In a future, post-apocalyptic Los Angeles brought about by nuclear decimation, citizens must live in underground bunkers to protect themselves from radiation, mutants and bandits.
When a corrupt force of wealth and power covets the lands of a group of diverse and atypical families and tries to drive them out, they must pursue their Manifest Destiny.

node.text: ファイブ・ナイツ・アット・フレディーズ２
佛萊迪餐館之五夜驚魂2

plotText.plainText: One year after the supernatural nightmare at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, Abby runs away to reconnect with her animatronic friends, uncovering dark secrets about the true origins of Freddy's and unleashing a horror hidden for decades.

Famous movie actor Jay Kelly embarks on a journey of self-discovery, confronting his past and present with his devoted manager Ron. Poignant and humor-filled, pitched at the intersection of regrets and glories.

node.text: Hamnet - A Vida Antes de Hamlet

plotText.plainText: After losing their son Hamnet to plague, Agnes and William Shakespeare grapple with grief in 16th-century England. A healer, Agnes must find strength to care for her surviving children while processing her devastating loss.
In 1977, a technology expert flees from a mysterious past and returns to his hometown of Recife in search of peace. He soon realizes that the city is far from being the refuge he seeks.
Follows an aspiring actress working on a U.S. military base that simulates an Iraqi war zone.
An eight-year-old girl asks her scheming neighbor for help in killing the monster under her bed that she thinks ate her family.

node.text: Avatar: De feu et de cendres
アバター　ファイヤー・アンド・アッシュ

plotText.plainText: Jake and Neytiri's family grapples with grief after Neteyam's death, encountering a new, aggressive Na'vi tribe, the Ash People, who are led by the fiery Varang, as the conflict on Pandora escalates and a new moral focus emerges.
A struggling woman is happy to start over as a housemaid for an affluent, elite couple.

As their marriage unravels, Alex faces middle age and divorce, seeking new purpose in the New York comedy scene. Meanwhile, his wife Tess confronts sacrifices made for their family, forcing them to navigate co-parenting and identities.
In 1980s Indiana, a group of young friends witness supernatural forces and secret government exploits. As they search for answers, the children unravel a series of extraordinary mysteries.
A group of friends are going through a mid-life crisis. They decide to remake a favorite movie from their youth but encounter unexpected events when they enter the jungle.
Marty Mauser, a young man with a dream no one respects, goes to hell and back in pursuit of greatness.

node.text: フランケンシュタイン

plotText.plainText: Dr. Victor Frankenstein, a brilliant but egotistical scientist, brings a creature to life in a monstrous experiment that ultimately leads to the undoing of both the creator and his tragic creation.
In a world overtaken by a mysterious wave of forced happiness, Carol Sturka, one of the few immune, must uncover what's really going on - and save humanity from its own bliss.
Elphaba, the future Wicked Witch of the West and her relationship with Glinda, the Good Witch of the North. The second of a two-part feature film adaptation of the Broadway musical.
Brave rabbit cop Judy Hopps and her friend, the fox Nick Wilde, team up again to crack a new case, the most perilous and intricate of their careers.

In an afterlife where souls have one week to decide where to spend eternity, Joan is faced with the impossible choice between the man she spent her life with and her first love, who died young and has waited decades for her to arrive.
